knowledge.author: Mark Rippetoe
knowledge.title: The Big Three Compound Priority
knowledge.description: Prioritize the squat, bench press, and deadlift as the foundation of any strength program. These three exercises work the most muscle mass with the heaviest weights, providing the greatest stimulus for strength development. All other exercises should supplement these primary movements, not replace them.

exercise_recommendations.when_to_use: Primary lower body strength movement for all trainees

modifications.knee_pain: Use box squats or reduce range of motion
modifications.back_pain: Use front squats or safety squat bar
modifications.beginner: Start with bodyweight squats to learn movement pattern

guidelines.rule: Always perform compound movements before isolation exercises
guidelines.rationale: Compound movements require the most energy and coordination when fresh

knowledge.author: Kelly Starrett
knowledge.title: Movement Quality Before Intensity
knowledge.description: Perfect movement patterns must be established before adding load or speed. Poor movement quality under load creates compensation patterns that lead to injury and inefficient movement. Focus on mobility and stability work to address movement restrictions before progressing to loaded movements.

exercise_recommendations.when_to_use: Daily mobility work and warm-up preparation

guidelines.rule: Address mobility restrictions before adding load
guidelines.rationale: Loading dysfunctional movement patterns creates injury risk

knowledge.author: Michael Matthews
knowledge.title: Progressive Overload for Body Composition
knowledge.description: For aesthetic goals, focus on progressive overload in the 8-12 rep range to maximize muscle hypertrophy while managing fatigue. Compound movements should form the base, with isolation work targeting specific areas that need development. Volume should be distributed across the week to allow for recovery.

exercise_recommendations.when_to_use: For glute development and aesthetic lower body goals

knowledge.author: Gray Cook
knowledge.title: Address Individual Movement Limitations
knowledge.description: Every athlete has unique movement limitations that must be identified and addressed before progressing to sport-specific training. Use movement screens to identify dysfunctions, then apply corrective exercises to restore proper movement patterns. Training should progress from stability to mobility to strength.

guidelines.rule: Screen movement patterns before designing programs
guidelines.rationale: Individual limitations determine exercise selection and progression

knowledge.book_title: The New Encyclopedia of Modern Bodybuilding
knowledge.author: Arnold Schwarzenegger
knowledge.title: Volume Progression for Hypertrophy
knowledge.description: Muscle growth requires progressive increases in training volume over time. Start with moderate volume and add sets, exercises, or training days as adaptation occurs. Different muscle groups respond to different volume thresholds, with larger muscles generally requiring more volume than smaller ones.
